climbs.name: Night Gallery
climbs.fa: Todd Gordon, Marge Floyd, Jim Angione & Dave Evans, September 1986

content.description: Go up and left up an easy corner, walk right across a nice ledge to a nice leftfacing layback crack. Up this to some steeper and wider ground, with a couple of tricky bits. Theres a comfortable spot to setup the belay with medium-large gear just below the summit, which you curl around into a ramp that descends to the south.
content.protection: We used mostly cams, no fixed anchors.
content.location: The NE face was tall and very shady and cast a long shadow when we got there midafternoon. Night Gallery finishes left of Shooting Gallery, these two routes go up the middle of this face.

climbs.name: Generic Route
climbs.fa: Alan Bartlett and Dave Black, Jan. 1983

content.description: An unpleasant, grainy offwidth. The name "Generic Crack" is too kind for this route.
content.location: In front of the east face of the rock.

content.description: A bombay squeeze chimney start (crux) leads up to an overhanging hand and fist crack, and then an easy offwidth/squeeze chimney above.
content.protection: No protection for the crux start, but it's a good landing.  A standard rack gives good protection above.
content.location: A short route on the east face, starting right at ground level
